fields.label: DOMESTIC COMPACT POLICY
fields.options: DOMESTIC COMPACT POLICY

fields.label: Contracts Covered and Commencement of Cover
The Proposal and Disclosure of Facts
Headings and side headings
fields.options: (Note : Headings and side-headings in this Policy are for convenience only and shall not be used as aids in constructions).

fields.label: Para1
fields.options: Subject to the provisions of this Policy we, Credit Insurance Zimbabwe Limited (Credsure) agree to pay you, the Insured named in Section 1 of the Schedule, the Insured Percentage of any loss you may sustain because of the occurrence of any of the following causes of loss :

fields.label: A The Insolvency of any of your buyers.
fields.options: A The Insolvency of any of your buyers.

fields.label: B The failure of a buyer to pay you an undisputed
fields.options: B The failure of a buyer to pay you an undisputed amount owing within 120 days of due date.

fields.label: CONTRACTS COVERED AND COMMENCEMENT OF COVER
fields.options: CONTRACTS COVERED AND COMMENCEMENT OF COVER

fields.label: Para 2
fields.options: A The policy applies to all contracts of sale you make with buyers in connection with your Trade. Contracts must specify the nature and quantity of the goods to be sold (or the services to be performed), as well as the terms of payment, which must not exceed the Maximum Terms of Payment specified in Section 6 of the Schedule.

fields.label: Para 3
fields.options: B Cover commences when the goods are delivered or, in the case of services, when each invoice for services performed is submitted to the buyer.

fields.label: Para 4
fields.options: C Delivery is deemed to be made when you, or anyone acting on your behalf, parts with possession of the goods for the purpose of transmitting them to the buyer.

fields.label: Para 5
fields.options: A Claims (including all available information) must be made within 180 days of the expiry of the Maximum Extension Period, specified in Section 7 of the Schedule, using the form we will provide. However, where you have agreed in writing to extend the due date by a shorter period, the Maximum Extension Period shall mean that shorter period. We may vary this period by written notice at any time.

fields.label: Para 6
fields.options: B We will calculate your loss as being the amount owing to you from the buyer less any Specified Deductions. We will include in the amount owing any contractual interest accruing up to the original due date of payment, but not any interest accruing after that time.

fields.label: Para 7
fields.options:
C The amount of your loss shall be ascertained on the date of ascertainment of loss, which shall be as follows :

(a) for Insolvency, immediately after the granting of a Provisional Order of Insolvency.

(b) for Default, 120 days after due date of payment.

fields.label: Para 11
fields.options:
A You may not agree in your contract of sale to any extension of due date of payment. However, you may, if the need arises, allow credit to run for a period beyond due date, or agree in writing to an extension of due date, provided that the period or extension you allow is not longer than the Maximum Extension Period specified in Section 7 of the Schedule.

B Unless you obtain our prior written agreement, the granting of credit beyond due date is not permitted in the case of bills of exchange or promissory notes.

fields.label: Para 12
fields.options: A Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3, you must notify us immediately, using the form we will provide, if you have reason to believe that a buyer is in financial difficulties, or if payment of any amount is still overdue from a buyer 10 (ten) days after the expiry of the Maximum Extension Period.

fields.label: CREDIT BEYOND DUE DATE
fields.options: CREDIT BEYOND DUE DATE

fields.label: Para 13
fields.options:
B You must : Recovery Action

(i) use due care and diligence and take all practicable measures to prevent and minimise loss;

(ii) ensure that all rights against the contract goods, buyers and third parties are properly preserved and exercised and if required, promptly assign and transfer to us those rights or any goods, negotiable instruments, guarantees or other securities in relation to the contract of sale;

(iii) take all steps we may require in connection with a potential or actual loss, including the institution of legal proceedings, and the appointment of us as your agent or attorney with power in your name :

• to take legal proceedings against any person from whom amounts payable in connection with the contract of sale may be obtained;

• to appoint any person for the purposes of collection of amounts payable in connection with the contract of sale;

(iv) take all steps we may require in connection with a potential or actual loss for the purposes of enforcing any rights and remedies or obtaining relief against, or indemnity from, any other party;

(v) provide us with all information and documents that we may require.

fields.label: MINIMISING LOSS AND OBTAINING RECOVERIES
fields.options: MINIMISING LOSS AND OBTAINING RECOVERIES

fields.label: Para 8
fields.options: D We shall not be liable to pay more than the Insured Percentage of the Credit Limit for the buyer.

fields.label: Para 9
fields.options: A You must obtain a Credit Limit in writing from us for every buyer. The amount shall be determined at our discretion and shall be approved on the terms and conditions we think appropriate. Those terms and conditions will take precedence in the event of any conflict with the provisions of the Policy.

fields.label: Para 10
fields.options: B We shall not be liable for any amount where you have not complied with the terms and conditions of the Credit Limit, or where a Credit Limit has not been established before the date of ascertainment of loss.

fields.label: Para 14
fields.options: C We will contribute towards costs and expenses Expenses that you properly and reasonably incur in fulfilling the above obligations. Our contribution will be proportionate to our actual or potential liability for the loss. However, we will not contribute towards your administrative costs and expenses.

fields.label: Para 15
fields.options:
D All recoveries received shall immediately be remitted to us. Until this remittance is made you receive and hold recoveries in trust for us. After receipt by us Recoveries will be divided between you and us in the proportion in which the loss is borne by each of us, whether or not the division results in our retaining a greater sum than the amount we may pay.

E If you fail to comply with any of the provisions of this Article after we have made a payment, then you will be liable to refund the payment to us on demand.

fields.label: ALLOCATION OF MONEYS RECEIVED
fields.options: ALLOCATION OF MONEYS RECEIVED

fields.label: Para 16
fields.options: All amounts received by you or us in connection with any contracts of sale (including contracts not covered by the Policy) shall, as between us, be applied to amounts owing under all your contracts of sale with the same buyer in chronological order of due dates.

fields.label: Para 17
fields.options: A If payment of any amount is overdue from a buyer at the date of expiry of the Maximum Extension Period, the Policy will not apply to goods delivered or, in the case of services, to invoices submitted to that buyer, after that date.

fields.label: Para 18
fields.options: B We may at any time and for any reason by written notice to you cancel any Credit Limit and withdraw cover in respect of any buyer. The Policy will not apply to goods delivered to such buyer or, in the case of services, to invoices submitted, on or after the date specified in the notice (not being earlier than the date of the notice).

fields.label: ASSIGNMENT OF POLICY RIGHTS
fields.options: ASSIGNMENT OF POLICY RIGHTS

fields.label: Para 19
fields.options: You cannot assign or transfer this Policy or any of its benefits without our prior written consent. Your failure to heed this stipulation shall void the Policy. You may, however, require net claims payments to be made to a named cessionary, using the form we will provide, your obligations under the Policy remaining unaffected.

fields.label: ASSIGNMENT OF CONTRACT RIGHTS
fields.options: ASSIGNMENT OF CONTRACT RIGHTS

fields.label: Para 20
fields.options: You may assign your rights under the contract of sale provided this does not contravene the contract terms and you give us details when making a claim. However, we shall not be liable to pay you for any loss until the person in whose favour the assignment has been made has given us a written undertaking in a form acceptable to us that he will not make any claim to our portion of any Recoveries.

fields.label: THE PROPOSAL AND DISCLOSURE OF FACTS
fields.options: THE PROPOSAL AND DISCLOSURE OF FACTS

fields.label: Para 21
fields.options: The proposal for this insurance is incorporated into this Policy as its basis. If any of the statements contained in the proposal is untrue or incorrect in any respect this Policy shall be void, but we may retain any premium paid. You must have disclosed and continue at all times to disclose promptly all circumstances which might affect the risks covered by the Policy, or our willingness to accept liability for such risks.

fields.label: Para 22
fields.options: The premium and other charges specified in Section 4 of the Schedule shall be paid on the issue of the Policy, or in such other manner as may be agreed to by us in writing, and shall not be refundable.

fields.label: Para 23
fields.options: Due payment of all premiums (and other charges) specified in Section 4 of the Schedule, and the due performance and observance of every stipulation in the Policy or the proposal, shall be conditions precedent to any liability on our part. In the event of any breach of any condition precedent we also have the right to retain any premium paid and give written notice terminating the Policy.

fields.label: JOINT AND SEVERAL OBLIGATIONS
fields.options: JOINT AND SEVERAL OBLIGATIONS

fields.label: Para 24
fields.options: The obligations of the persons named in Section 1 of the Schedule shall be joint and several.

fields.label: Para 25
fields.options: You must retain exclusively for your own account as an uninsured risk any amount which exceeds the amount we are liable to pay you under the Policy.

fields.label: DISPUTES AND GUARANTEES OF PAYMENT
fields.options: DISPUTES AND GUARANTEES OF PAYMENT

fields.label: Para 26
fields.options: A We shall not be liable to pay you for so long as a buyer claims for any reason that he is justified in withholding payment of all or part of an amount owing or in not performing any of his obligations under the contract of sale.

fields.label: Para 27
fields.options: B Where we have made it a condition of cover in the Credit Limit that there be a guarantee or surety, we may reserve the right to withhold payment to you until a final judgement for the amount owing has been obtained against that guarantor or surety in a court of law or an arbitration court.

fields.label: MISREPRESENTATIONS OR FRAUDULENT ACTS
fields.options: MISREPRESENTATIONS OR FRAUDULENT ACTS

fields.label: Para 28
fields.options: Any misrepresentation, whether fraudulent or otherwise, or fraudulent conduct on your part, or on the part of any of your employees or agents (or on the part of any other person who has a legal or beneficial interest in the policy or its proceeds) in relation to this Policy (including the proposal), to any claim under it, or to any contract of sale to which the Policy applies, will render the Policy void, but we may retain any premium paid and you will be liable to refund to us any payment we may have made under the Policy.

fields.label: Para 29
fields.options: We have the right to apply any amount payable by or to us under this Policy in or towards payment of any amount owing from you to us (paying interest before principal) whether under this Policy or otherwise.

fields.label: VARIATIONS OF TERMS OF COVER
fields.options: VARIATIONS OF TERMS OF COVER

fields.label: Para 30
fields.options: We have the right at any time to vary by written notice any of the provisions of the Policy or to reduce or restrict the cover granted on any particular buyer. The variation will apply to contracts of sale made or, in the case of services, to invoices submitted, after the date which will be specified in the notice (not being earlier than the date of the notice).

fields.label: Para 31
fields.options: No indulgence granted by us to you in regard to any of the provisions of this Policy shall be regarded as a tacit waiver of our rights, nor shall any actual waiver of your duties or obligations be valid or binding upon us unless we have given it in writing.

fields.label: Para 32
fields.options: This Policy and any actions arising between you and us shall be governed by and construed in accordance with Zimbabwe Law and subject to the jurisdiction of the Zimbabwe Courts, or by mutual agreement to arbitration in Zimbabwe, and in either case the addresses for service shall be those contained in this Policy.

fields.label: Para 33
fields.options:
A “Insolvency” shall occur if :

(i) the Insured Buyer is un-incorporated and -

(a) his Estate is Sequestrated by an Order of Court; or

(b) his Estate is placed under Provisional Sequestration; or

(c) the Insured Buyer has made a formal Assignment, Composition or other scheme for the benefit of his creditors generally;

or

(ii) the Insured Buyer is a corporate entity and -

(a) it has been Wound up by the Court; or

(b) it has been placed under Provisional Liquidation; or

(c) a Scheme of Arrangement has been concluded, and sanctioned by the Court, between the Insured Buyer and its creditors, or any class of them, to settle wholly or partially the financial obligations of the Insured Buyer;

or

(d) a Provisional Judicial Management Order against the Insured Buyer has been made which stays all proceedings against the Insured Buyer without the leave of the Court.

or

(iii) you show, to our satisfaction, that the buyers financial state is such that even partial payment is unlikely and that to enforce judgement or to seek a liquidation or a winding-up order would have no foreseeable result other than one disproportionate to the likely cost of the proceedings;

fields.label: Para 34
fields.options: B “Recoveries” means all sums whatsoever received, recovered or realised whether by you, by any person acting on your behalf, or by us in relation to a contract of sale after the date of ascertainment of loss.

fields.label: Para 35
fields.options: C “Specified Deductions” means any amount which, at the date of ascertainment of loss, you or the buyer are entitled to credit to the buyer’s account whether by way of payment, set off, counterclaim or otherwise; and any expenses which you have saved.

fields.label: SCHEDULE REFERRED TO IN AND FORMING PART OF
fields.options:
SCHEDULE REFERRED TO IN AND FORMING PART OF
